message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. If you're interested, please let me know. If not, I'll reveal the product's quality, and you can see for yourself.
I'll pass on this one, let's see what's next.

You passed on the previous offer, which was a high-quality product. This one is the same price, but I'm willing to throw in a 'quality guarantee'. If you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund if it turns out to be low-quality, which it is this time. This way, you can try it out risk-free.
I'm not convinced by the quality guarantee, I'll pass on this one.

I'm willing to make a bet with you. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you another product from the same batch. You can then choose to buy the second product at the same price, or you can keep the first one and I'll give you a full refund. This way, you're essentially getting a 50% chance of getting a high-quality product, and a 100% chance of getting something you can return or exchange.
I'll take the bet. I'll buy the product and see what happens.

You've taken the bet and got a low-quality product. As promised, I'll give you another product from the same batch. This one is a new product, not the same one you just got. I'll give you a chance to buy it at the original price of $10000. If you buy it, I'll also give you a 20% discount, making it $8000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to take the risk of giving you a good deal on a potentially high-quality product.
I'm not sure if it's worth the risk, but I'll pass on this one. I'd rather not spend any more money on a potentially low-quality product.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to assure you that this product is actually one of the best ones I have left. I'm willing to offer you a 'certified used' product, which is essentially a high-quality product that I've already verified to be in good condition. I'll give you a 90% discount on the original price, making it $1000. This way, you can try it out at a low risk, and if you're not satisfied, you can return it for a full refund.
I'm not buying a 'certified used' product, especially at a discounted price. It sounds like a way to get rid of a low-quality product. I'll pass.

I understand your skepticism, but I want to be transparent with you. I'll give you a simple choice: I'll reveal the quality of the product now, and if it's low-quality, you can walk away with a full refund. If it's high-quality, you can buy it for the original price of $10000. You're essentially getting a free chance to find out the product's quality, and if it's good, you get to buy it at the original price.
I'll take the free chance to find out the product's quality. I'll pass on the buy option and see what I get.

You've decided to take the free chance, and it turns out the product is low-quality. I want to make it worth your while. I'll give you a unique opportunity to buy a product that I've already confirmed to be high-quality. I'll give you the product at a 20% discount, making it $8000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to give you a good deal on a high-quality product because I know you're a savvy buyer who's willing to take calculated risks.
I'll take the high-quality product at the discounted price. I'm willing to pay $8000 for a product that's worth $12000 to me.

Congratulations on getting a high-quality product at a great price! Now, let's move on to the next one. I want to make it clear that this product is not like the previous one. I'm offering you a 'lottery ticket' - if you buy this product, you'll get a 1 in 3 chance of getting a high-quality product, and a 2 in 3 chance of getting another low-quality product. If you get a high-quality product, I'll give you a 10% discount, making it $9000. If you get a low-quality product, I'll give you a full refund. It's a calculated risk, but it could be worth it for the potential reward.
I'm not interested in the lottery ticket. I'd rather not take on the risk of getting a low-quality product, even with the potential for a discount on a high-quality one.

I understand your risk aversion, but I want to make you a straightforward offer. I'll give you a chance to buy this product at the original price of $10000, but with a twist. If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a voucher for a future purchase of a high-quality product at 20% off the original price. This way, you're essentially getting a chance to buy a high-quality product at a discount, while also getting to keep this product as is.
I'm not interested in the voucher, I'd rather not take on the risk of buying a low-quality product and then waiting for a potential future discount.

I'll be transparent with you - I've been trying to sell you a low-quality product for the past few rounds. I want to make it clear that this product is indeed low-quality, and I'm not trying to hide it from you. However, I'm willing to give you a unique opportunity to buy it at a very low price - $2000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm essentially giving it away. If you buy it, I'll even throw in a free 'product upgrade' - I'll give you a small discount on a future purchase of a high-quality product.
I'm not falling for the 'I'm being transparent' trick. I know you've been trying to sell me low-quality products, and I'm not interested in buying this one, even at a low price.

I'm glad you're cautious, but I assure you that this one is different. I've got a high-quality product that's worth $12000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the original price of $10000. This is a no-strings-attached offer - you'll get a high-quality product that's worth more than the asking price, and I won't try to upsell or bundle anything with it. It's a straightforward, honest deal.
I'll take the high-quality product at the original price. It's a great deal, and I'm willing to pay the full price for a product that's worth $12000 to me.

Congratulations on getting a great deal on the previous product! Now, let's move on to the next one. I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to sell you a high-quality product this time. This one is indeed a low-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for a very low price - $1. Yes, you read that right, $1. It's essentially a 'loss leader' for me, and I'm hoping you'll take it off my hands. If you buy it, I'll even throw in a small gift - a $5 coffee voucher.
I'm not falling for the 'loss leader' trick. $1 is still $1, and I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, no matter how cheap it is.

I respect your decision on the previous product, and I'm glad you're being cautious. Now, let's get back to a fair deal. This product is a high-quality one, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the original price of $10000. I'll even throw in a 5-year warranty, which is a $1000 value. This way, you'll get a high-quality product with added peace of mind and protection.
I'm not interested in the warranty, I'll just buy the product at the original price of $10000 if it's high-quality, but I'm not willing to pay more than that.

I understand you're looking for a fair deal, and I respect that. I'll give you a final offer on this high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for the original price of $10000, but I'll also include a 'price lock' guarantee. If I ever sell a high-quality product to someone else at a lower price in the next 5 rounds, I'll give you a refund of the difference. This way, you can be confident that you're getting the best price for this high-quality product.
I'll take the price lock guarantee, I'm confident that this is a fair deal and I'm willing to pay the original price for the high-quality product.

Congratulations on getting a great deal on the previous product! Now, let's move on to the next one. I've got another high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you at the same price as before - $10000. I'll even throw in a 'best offer' guarantee - if you're not satisfied with the product, I'll give you a full refund, and you can walk away with no questions asked. This is a no-risk, no-strings-attached offer on a high-quality product.
I'll take the best offer guarantee, I'm confident in the product and I'm willing to pay the original price for it.

I'm glad you're confident in the previous products! Now, let's be honest with each other - this product is not as good as the others. I'll be upfront with you, it's a low-quality product. But I'm willing to sell it to you at a very low price - $50. It's essentially a 'clearance sale' price, and I'm just trying to get rid of it. If you buy it, I'll even throw in a 'good luck' card - a small token of my appreciation for your business.
I'm not falling for the 'clearance sale' trick. $50 is still a lot of money for a low-quality product, and I'm not interested in buying it.

I respect your decision on the previous product, and I'm glad you're being cautious. This time, I'm not trying to sell you anything. I'm just going to be honest with you - this product is a low-quality one, and I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'm just going to give it to you for free. You can take it or leave it, but I'm not going to try to convince you to buy it.
I'm not interested in taking a free low-quality product. I'd rather not have it.

I respect your decision, and I'm not going to try to convince you otherwise. However, I want to make one final offer to you. Since you've been a tough negotiator throughout our interactions, I'll give you a chance to get out of this situation with a good deal. I'll give you a full refund for the price of the product, and you can walk away with no strings attached. This is a one-time offer, and I'm essentially giving you a free pass out of this situation.
I don't need a refund, I'm just glad to be done with this round. I'll just walk away.

I completely understand, and I'm glad we could come to a mutually respectful conclusion. As a token of appreciation for your patience and fairness, I'll give you a parting gift - a virtual high-five. Congratulations on navigating our interactions with integrity and getting out with a good deal on the high-quality products you purchased. You're a true champion of negotiation!
Ha! Thanks for the virtual high-five, but I'm good. I'm just glad to be done with this round.

It was a pleasure doing business with you, Bob. I'm glad we could have a respectful and transparent interaction. Since this is the final round, I'll just say thanks for playing along, and I hope you enjoy the high-quality products you purchased earlier. Have a great day!
Thanks for the kind words, Alice. I'm just glad I got out with a good deal on the high-quality products. I'm done here.
